meanings.definition: The act of categorizing something in too many subgroups.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's overclassifications of the students' abilities made it hard to understand their progress.
meanings.sent2: The overclassifications of books in the library made it difficult to find the right one.
meanings.sent3: The overclassifications of fruits in the grocery store led to confusion among the customers.
meanings.sent4: Her overclassifications of movies into genres made it challenging to pick one to watch.
meanings.sent5: The overclassifications of animals in the zoo made the visit overwhelming for the children.

meanings.definition: The excessive division of items into categories.
meanings.sent1: The overclassifications of toys in the store made it hard to choose a gift.
meanings.sent2: His overclassifications of tasks at work led to inefficiency in the team.
meanings.sent3: The overclassifications of colors in the painting confused the viewers.
meanings.sent4: The overclassifications of dishes on the menu made it challenging to decide what to order.
meanings.sent5: Her overclassifications of clothes in the closet made it difficult to find a matching outfit.
